Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a deep body and an unpierced lug on the left side. On top of the nozzle is a rectangular stamp with relief retrograde Greek letters. At the rear are three vertical lines, scratched before firing. There is a substantial base-ring. Covered with a red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q529.bis)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
